http://www.lsoft.com/images/listserv-community.gif http://www.lsoft.com/images/listserv_small.gif FESTIVAL List FESTIVAL List Archives https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?RSS&L=FESTIVAL&v=ATOM1.0
This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=FESTIVAL.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2014-12-04T09:27:31Z Bex Carrington 2014-12-04T09:27:13+00:00 2014-12-04T09:27:13+00:00 Neurocreator - new online magazine for artists & creative industries https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FESTIVAL;e6710f0c.1412 ***Apologies for cross-posting***<br><br>Hello Creators,<br><br>the inaugural journal of Neurocreator introduces a different way of looking at how creators do what we do.<br><br>From the traditions of general semantics, neuro-linguistics, changework therapies and the latest explorations of neuroscience comes an approach that is already transforming creators' lives.<br><br>For instance, the concepts of inspiration and the muse are based on very old ideas - such as the belief system of the Roman Empire and their gods! Surely in the 21st Century we can get closer to the reality of the creative process? [...] van Elferen, Isabella 2014-10-23T12:19:01+01:00 2014-10-23T12:19:01+01:00 One week to go: CfP International Conference for the Fantastic in the Arts https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FESTIVAL;dedeaf08.1410 The CFP for next March's International Conference on the Fantastic in the Arts closes a little over a week from now, at Halloween. Any abstracts or panel proposals on music, theatre, performance, video games, comics, visual arts, and fan culture are welcome at the VPAA Division. Queries can be sent to my email address: I.vanElferen@kingston.ac.uk<mailto:I.vanElferen@kingston.ac.uk> or i.a.m.vanelferen@gmail.com<mailto:i.a.m.vanelferen@gmail.com>. If you'd like to submit to any other Division (Fantasy Lit, SF, Horror, Film, CYA, International Fantastic) please check our website for the appropriate contact information. Sam Farley 2014-10-23T11:48:08+01:00 2014-10-23T11:48:08+01:00 Cyber Harassment Research https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FESTIVAL;85256de1.1410 Hello All,<br><br>This may be of interest to some on the list.<br><br>I'm a doctoral researcher at the University of Sheffield, investigating how negative behaviours received through technology affect employees. To understand the impact of negative technology perpetrated acts, I'm looking for volunteers to take a questionnaire involving questions on negative technological experiences, job satisfaction, health and work engagement. [...] van Elferen, Isabella 2014-09-24T17:24:40+01:00 2014-09-24T17:24:40+01:00 CFP International Conference on the Fantastic in the Arts https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FESTIVAL;70267f84.1409 CALL FOR PAPER AND PANEL PROPOSALS<br><br>36th International Conference on the Fantastic in the Arts<br><br>The Scientific Imagination<br><br>March 18-22, 2015<br><br>Marriott Orlando Airport Hotel<br><br>The ICFA welcomes papers on any aspect of the fantastic - including fantasy, science fiction, weird fiction, horror, gothic, and fairy tales.<br><br>This year, we are particularly interested in topics related to our theme, The Scientific Imagination. Join us as we explore the possibilities and intersections of science and imagination\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdfrom Faust and Frankenstein, through the Golden Age and the New Wave, to steampunk and mash-ups\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdin all their guises, including fiction, film, television, music, theater, comics, [...] Bex Carrington 2014-04-16T11:34:39+01:00 2014-04-16T11:34:39+01:00 Yahoo Account holders IMPORTANT - please read https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FESTIVAL;6ad717b1.1404 I have been asked to pass on the following information by JISCMail:<br><br>Yahoo have recently changed the security settings on their email servers which is causing major issues with mailing list services across the world, including JiscMail.<br><br>Yahoo have changed their security settings in a way that causes emails sent through a mailing list service to be identified as junk-mail by email providers that using certain security systems. This causes many email providers including Google, Microsoft and Yahoo themselves, to reject any list emails originating from a Yahoo account. These rejections, can in some cases, cause subscribers to be removed [...]
